page.title: 09A SCHOOLDAY - Wootton Wawen
page.content: I am Anna Jarmy, a girl living at Mappleborough Green, five miles from Wootton. One Friday morning I got up and dressed. I went down to breakfast for which my brother Timothy and I had cornflakes and toast. We went to school by car, arriving before 9 a.m. We first went swimming and then started class lessons at 10 a.m. We had to write out and learn our weekly spellings. After play we had Mathematics, at which I am good, and at noon I had to forecast the weather. I studied the temperature, the type and amount of cloud, the wind and air pressure. Then I used the computer to make a forecast. After dinner at school we had an English lesson, followed by Art and Craft. At 3.30, school ended. We said a prayer, said good-bye to everyone and went home.
